iModule - interface net.tmachine.gpg4.iModule.
This defines an FSM (finite state machine) for the status of a running module on a server.
iReadableSelectorHandler - interface net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.iReadableSelectorHandler.
Implements the READ stage of the four-stage system described in the gem
iRequestProcessor - interface net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.iRequestProcessor.
Implements the PROCESS stage of the four-stage system described in the gem
iResponseWriter - interface net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.iResponseWriter.
Implements the WRITE stage of the four-stage system described in the gem (or is proxied away by a caching layer)
iSelectorHandler - interface net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.iSelectorHandler.
Implementations of this interfact have a Selector that must be created at startup.
iWebserver - interface net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.iWebserver.
Represents a server that manages a set of Selector's - usually by indirecting to sub-classes.

PlainWritableSelectorHandler - class net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.PlainWritableSelectorHandler.
Exactly the same as GatheringWritableSelectorHandler, except that it doesn't use Gathering writes (because of a bug in JDK 1.4.2 which makes gathering writes VERY VERY slow with more than 20 or so buffers).

setByteBuffersFrom(Vector, HTTPRequest) - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.HTTPResponse
This is the most important method of all: When you have a Vector of BB's containing the data you wish to return as teh body of the response, you call this method, and it generates all the HTTP headers, and attaches a COPY of the list of BB's (although it only copies references to the BB's, not the BB's themselves).

U

UNLOADED - Static variable in interface net.tmachine.gpg4.iModule
Cannot return to any other states; this is usually a prelude to the class files being unloaded, and/or the entire server being shutdown.
UNLOADING - Static variable in interface net.tmachine.gpg4.iModule
being de-referenced, shutting down permanently, cannot return to any other state from this one
URIHeaders - Variable in class net.tmachine.gpg4.gameserver.HTTPRequest
 
unload() - Method in class net.tmachine.gpg4.bModule
 
unload() - Method in interface net.tmachine.gpg4.iModule
Attempts to get into the UNLOADED state; possible from ANY other state (roughly equivalent to "stop now!")
